data.text: Have mercy upon us, O Lord God of all, and behold us:
And send thy fear upon all the nations that seek not after thee.
Lift up thy hand against the strange nations,
As thou wast sanctified in us before them:
And let them know thee, as we have known thee,
Shew new signs, and make other strange wonders:
Raise up indignation, and pour out wrath:
Make the time short, remember the covenant,
Let him that escapeth be consumed by the rage of the fire;
Smite in sunder the heads of the rulers of the heathen,
Gather all the tribes of Jacob together,
O Lord, have mercy upon the people that is called by thy name,
O be merciful unto Jerusalem, thy holy city,
Fill Sion with thine unspeakable oracles,
Give testimony unto those that thou hast possessed from the beginning,
Reward them that wait for thee,
O Lord, hear the prayer of thy servants,
The belly devoureth all meats,
As the palate tasteth divers kinds of venison:
A froward heart causeth heaviness:
A woman will receive every man,
The beauty of a woman cheereth the countenance,
If there be kindness, meekness, and comfort, in her tongue,
He that getteth a wife beginneth a possession,
Where no hedge is, there the possession is spoiled:
Who will trust a thief well appointed,
